item.title: If you're feeling overwhelmed by the sheer amount of demos available at Steam Next Fest, we've narrowed down our must-play cozy game demos to save you the stress of searching for yourself
item.content:encoded: Save yourself from the hard work—let us do it for you.

item.title: Thanks to Mewgenics' cruel sidequest items, I've accidentally created the conditions for the most cursed run ever
item.content:encoded: Hang in there, kitty.

item.title: 'We expect supply constraints to be the headwind to gaming in Q1 and beyond' says Nvidia, although it claims demand and inventory levels are 'healthy'
item.content:encoded: A tempering of expectations, perhaps?

item.title: Project Windless creative director says the developers chose a 9-foot warlike rooster goliath as their protagonist because literally 'every candidate' interviewed to work on the game wanted to play as one: 'All of them—and we were like, OK'
item.content:encoded: Hard to argue with that.

item.title: Microsoft's execs can't stop hooting and hollering about AI, but Xbox's new overlords promise 'We've got no pressure' from up top that would 'flood our ecosystem with slop'
item.content:encoded: I'm relieved. Are you relieved? I'm relieved.

item.title: Fallout 76's next free update adds Bigfoot, a party-crasher that drops 4-star rewards: 'He's got a big club, and he throws exploding ticks at you, what else would you expect?'
item.content:encoded: You'll only have five minutes to deal with him before he dips back into the woods.

item.title: You might be as surprised as I was to learn that Assassin's Creed Mirage is one of the few games to use AI neural texture compression—the only one, I think
item.content:encoded: Now this is an AI use case I can get fully behind.

item.title: YouTuber sets out to cool a CPU with infinite ice loop machine and actually achieves it
item.content:encoded: Inefficient and impractical, but what the heck it actually works.

item.title: An Overwatch bug which allowed you to crash the game by typing in chat has been fixed, so don't make Blizzard regret letting you talk again: 'That bug accidentally made OW a safe place'
item.content:encoded: It's a blessing and a curse that chat's back.

item.title: Drop, seller of Lord of the Rings-themed keyboards and more, will be shutting down in March
item.content:encoded: Hitting backspace.

item.title: New Intel graphics driver claims a remarkable 35% performance boost for Panther Lake's nifty little iGPU in Witcher 3 at 1080p
item.content:encoded: Ye olde Arc A770 gets some fps upgrades, too.

item.title: Nvidia reports a truly astonishing $193.7 billion in annual data center revenue in its latest earnings call, up 75% year on year, while little old gaming brought in $16 billion
item.content:encoded: I think it's obvious why us gamers are perhaps not team green's top priority right now.

item.title: Beamdog swaggers in, says sorry I'm late, then surprise-patches Baldur's Gate 1 and 2 Enhanced 14 years after release
item.content:encoded: I'll be honest: I get more excited about this than patches for that other Baldur's Gate.

item.title: Here's the Resident Evil Requiem release time for your region
item.content:encoded: Return to Raccoon City and brutalise some zombies.

item.title: After getting Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora on PC Game Pass, unlocking its 'Unobtanium' max graphics mode, and then upgrading those stunning visuals even more with mods, I'm convinced this is the 'But can it run Crysis?' FPS PC gamers should install today
item.content:encoded: Maximum graphics, activated

item.title: It's been 10 years since the release of Stardew Valley, and these are the 10 best updates the game has released in that time
item.content:encoded: From new neighbours to uncharted isles, there's a lot to sink your teeth into.

item.title: One Redditor has 3D-printed a big yellow air duct to attach to their GPU, and the results are middling: It 'does nothing but it looks cool'
item.content:encoded: Now I kinda want one too.

item.title: PC Gamer magazine's new issue is on sale now: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War 4
item.content:encoded: Plus, Solasta 2, Resident Evil Requiem, Terra Invicta, Mewgenics, Going Medieval, Forza Horizon 6, Duke Nukem 3D, gaming mousepads, and much more, too

item.title: All Marathon Twitch Drops and how to get them
item.content:encoded: Free wormy profile items, a custom weapon skin, and a sponsored kit.

item.title: Arc Raiders' latest patch has made Rocketeers deadlier, and you can guess how happy it's made players: 'The problem with rocketeers was their abundance of mercy'
item.content:encoded: Because we all needed more aggressive rocketeers.

item.title: Overwatch's second weekend of Conquest 'had a higher daily player count' than its opening weekend as Blizzard's FPS gains momentum
item.content:encoded: The only way is up.

item.title: If you've ever thought that your desktop is a bit lonely, Desktop Mate has just announced a Sanrio DLC that is so adorable it might make my heart burst
item.content:encoded: Your desktop just got a whole lot cuter.

item.title: Here's when World of Warcraft: Midnight launches in your time zone
item.content:encoded: The dawn of a new era approaches.

item.title: Only expert farmers will harvest a high score in our Stardew Valley quiz sown for Pelican Town veterans
item.content:encoded: Celebrate Stardew Valley's 10th anniversary with trivia.

item.title: 'Please, let us cook more': Windrose devs aren't ready to give players a release date yet
item.content:encoded: "We want to lock this in firmly and ship the game on time," said Windrose Crew on its Discord.

item.title: Amazon's gaming walkback continues as it ends publishing deal for a new racing game being headed up by former Forza Horizon creative director
item.content:encoded: Maverick Games has confirmed that it is "no longer working with Amazon Games Studio."

item.title: Sony killed a fan-made Bloodborne tribute last year, as the game continues to languish on PS4: 'Why are you making such absurd decisions, Sony?'
item.content:encoded: With the closure of Bluepoint dashing hopes of a remake, it hurts all the more.

item.title: Reigns: The Witcher review
item.content:encoded: Toss a card to your witcher.

item.title: 10 years later, I still can't believe Eric Barone thought Harvest Moon fans would hate Stardew Valley
item.content:encoded: "I still didn't think it was going to be super popular," Barone said of the days leading up to Stardew Valley's launch in 2016.

item.title: Dr Disrespect lies about Marathon partnership
item.content:encoded: The streamer was banned from Twitch in 2020 over inappropriate DMs with a minor, and now uses his infamy to extract denials from game developers.

item.title: New York sues Valve for 'letting children and adults illegally gamble' with loot boxes
item.content:encoded: The lawsuit aims to "stop Valve from promoting gambling features in its games, disgorge all ill-gotten gains, and pay fines for violating New York’s laws."

item.title: Assassin's Creed Hexe creative director Clint Hocking leaves Ubisoft, former Black Flag director Jean Guesden takes over as development continues under 'a seasoned team'
item.content:encoded: Hocking's departure follows just days after Ubisoft announced a new leadership team for the Assassin's Creed franchise.

item.title: Embark explains why it jacked up the cost of crafting Wolfpacks in Arc Raiders, concedes some players aren't happy about it
item.content:encoded: "Rather than diminish the capability of the Wolfpack itself, we opted to adjust the crafting components."

item.title: This co-op FPS Steam demo feels poised to do for spellslinging robot cowboys what Deep Rock Galactic did for space dwarves
item.content:encoded: Far Far West's frantic gunfights earn a hearty yeehaw from me.

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Remake guide: puzzles, collectibles, secrets, and the best weapons
item.content:encoded: Where's everyone going? Bingo?

item.title: Skate studio Full Circle is laying off employees, says having fewer people working there will enable it to 'move faster, listen more closely, and deliver consistently for all of you,' somehow
item.content:encoded: Five months after launching into early access, Skate's player numbers on Steam have declined precipitously.

item.title: My new indie darling is this crafting game stuffed with hand-sculpted creatures made by a husband and wife dev team
item.content:encoded: OddFauna's handmade critters are absolute catnip for my crafting game brain.

item.title: Amanita Design teases the Orwell-inspired Phonopolis with a surprisingly funny demo about messing with people, running from the cops, and fighting fascism even when you don't really want to
item.content:encoded: The next game from the studio behind Botanicula, Samorost, and Chuchel looks to be shaping up very well.

item.title: Resident Evil director Paul W. S. Anderson says he's got no time for people who do game adaptations without playing them—'That's outrageous'
item.content:encoded: And also finds time to demolish that awful Doom movie.

item.title: 'The compute bottleneck is massively under appreciated' says Google AI Studio lead: 'I would guess the gap between supply and demand is growing [by a] single digit % every day'
item.content:encoded: 'In practice, this will be the rate limit on the impact AI will have in the economy/society.'

item.title: Modders file a Square Enix job application after it ballses up yet another FF7 release: 'Let us help you'
item.content:encoded: If you want something done right…

item.title: Arc Raiders' Shrouded Sky added lots of cool new toys, but my favourite part is the new quality-of-life features that have flown under the radar
item.content:encoded: The small changes are just as important as the big ones.

item.title: I thought the Midnight Ramen Shop demo might scratch the Papa's Pizzeria itch, but it actually just made me realise I could never run a ramen shop after getting everyone's orders wrong on purpose
item.content:encoded: Sometimes you have to embrace the chaos.

item.title: The company that stopped making memory for gamers just explained how important memory is for gamers. Yeah, really
item.content:encoded: You want 96 GB of VRAM, apparently...

item.title: Former Assassin's Creed and Far Cry director says Ubisoft 'became very allergic' to new games, which contributed to a 'talent drain'
item.content:encoded: Alex Hutchinson diagnoses the downward trajectory of his former employer.

item.title: Arc Raiders' latest weapon changes are a well-aimed nerf at free loadouters, and the Il Toro is thankfully next on the chopping block
item.content:encoded: Embark is focusing on "the balance between our low-tier and high-tier weapons".

item.title: The future of Nacon gaming accessories looks uncertain as the company files for insolvency
item.content:encoded: Will Nacon's hardware wing be the first to feel the brunt of debt restructuring efforts?

item.title: I thought Overwatch's new Arcade mode was a glitch, but it's actually a ridiculous cat-stuffed free-for-all where spamming 'meow' is mandatory
item.content:encoded: Meow meow meeeooww. Meow meow meeooww.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem PC performance analysis: Great visuals and decent frame rates all round, though path tracing's an obvious frame rate killer
item.content:encoded: Upscaling is a bit of a must-use, but that's a given these days.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem review
item.content:encoded: In with the new and the old.
